Fujio]] [[Shogakukan]] {{english anime licensees|NA[[Children's anime and manga|Children]] (various Shogakukan's kids magazines) December 1969 1996 45 List of Doraemon chapters Infobox animanga/Videotv series [[Doraemon (1973 anime)|Doraemon]] [[TMS Entertainment]] April 1, 1973 September 30, 1973 26 (52 segments, 2 segments per episode) Doraemon_(1979_anime)#Episodes Infobox animanga/Videotv series [[Doraemon (1979 anime)|Doraemon]] [[Shin-Ei Animation]] April 2, 1979 March 18, 2005 1787 List of Doraemon episodes (1979 anime) Infobox animanga/Videotv series [[Doraemon (2005 anime)|Doraemon]] [[Shin-Ei Animation]]

* ''[[The Doraemons]]'' * ''[[Dorabase]]'' * ''[[Kiteretsu Daihyakka]]'' Infobox animanga/FooterDoraemon(lang-jaドラえもん) is a Japanesemangaseries written and illustrated by the manga writing teamFujiko Fujio. The series has also been adapted into a successfulanimeseries andmedia franchise. The story revolves around aRobotrobotic catnamedDoraemon (character)Doraemon, whotime traveltravels back in timefrom the 22nd century to aid a pre-teen boy namednihongoNobita Nobi野比のび太Nobi Nobita.

The Doraemon manga series was first published in December 1969 in six different magazines. A total of 1,345 stories were created in the original series, which are published byShogakukanunder thenihongoTentōmushiてんとう虫manga brand, extending to forty-five volumes. The volumes are collected in the Takaoka Central Library inToyama PrefectureToyama, Japan, where Fujiko Fujio was born.Turner Broadcasting Systembought the rights to the Doraemon anime series in the mid-1980s for a United States English-language release,cite webhttp://www.jref.com/japan/travel/prefectures/kanagawa/doraemon_museum.shtmlFujiko F. Fujio MuseumJapan ReferenceSeptember 11, 2012but canceled it without explanation before broadcasting any episodes. In July 2013 it was announced that the manga would be released digitally in English via theAmazon Kindlee-bookservice. It isList of best-selling mangaone of the best-selling manga in the world, having sold over 100 million copies.

Awards for Doraemon include theJapan Cartoonists Association Awardfor excellence in 1973, the firstShogakukan Manga AwardforChildren's anime and mangachildren's mangain 1982,cite webhttp://comics.shogakukan.co.jp/mangasho/rist.htmlja:小学館漫画賞: 歴代受賞者ShogakukanJapaneseAugust 19, 2007and the firstOsamu Tezuka Culture Awardin 1997. In March 2008Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)Japan's Foreign Ministryappointed Doraemon as the nation's first "anime ambassador."Yamaguchi, Mari."Doraemon appointed Japan's first ever cartoon ambassador "China Post'', March 20, 2008.Ministry spokesman explained the novel decision as an attempt to help people in other countries understand Japanese anime better and to deepen their interest inJapanese culture.""Doraemon named 'anime ambassador',"Japan Today.March 15, 2008.The Foreign Ministry action confirms that Doraemon has come to be considered a Japanese cultural icon. In India, itsHindi,Telugu languageTelugu,Tamil languageTamiltranslation has been telecasted, where the anime version is the highest-rated kids' show; it won the best Kids' Show award at theNickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards India.Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards IndiaIn 2002 the anime character was acclaimed as an "Asian Hero" in a special feature survey conducted byTime Asiamagazine.Iyer, Pico."The Cuddliest Hero in Asia."Time(Asia).An edited English dub distributed byTV Asahiaired onDisney XDin the United States that started on July 7, 2014 at 12:30 PM, 11:30 AM (Central). On August 17, 2015,Boomerang (UK & Ireland)Boomerang UKstarted to broadcast the English dub of Doraemon. TheList of Doraemon filmsfilm seriesis the largest by number of admissions in Japan.
article.heading: Name
article.paragraph: The name "Doraemon" can be roughly translated to "stray." "Dora" derives from "dora neko" (brazen or stray cat, ), and is a corruption ofnora(stray). "Emon" is an archaic component of male given names like Goemon. "Dora" is not derived (directly) fromdora, meaning gong, but rather a pun on that and the fact that Doraemon lovesdorayaki. The nameNihongo"Doraemon"ドラえもんis stylized as an unusual mixture ofKatakana( 'dora') andHiragana( 'emon').
article.heading: Plot

link.part: The first appearance of Doraemon, who came via the time machine.

article.paragraph: Doraemon (character)Doraemonis sent back in time by a young boy named Sewashi Nobi to improve the circumstances of his grandfather,Nobita NobiNobita, so that his descendants may enjoy a better future. In the original timeline, Nobita experienced nothing but misery and misfortune manifested in the form of very poor grades and bullying throughout his life. This culminates in the burning down of a future business he sets up which leaves his family line beset with financial problems. In order to alter history and better the Nobi family's fortunes, Sewashi initially wanted to send a super-robot to protect Nobita, but with his meager allowance he could only afford an imperfectly-made factory-rejected toy: an anthropomorphic robot cat called Doraemon.

Doraemon has a pocket from which he produces toys, medicines, and tools from the future, all of which are referred to as 'gadgets' by Doraemon. Some of the gadgets are based on real Japanese household devices with fanciful twists, but most are completelyscience fiction. Thousands of gadgets have been featured in the series with such as the "bamboo-copter", a small head accessory that allows flight and the "Anywhere Door", a door that opens up to any place the user wishes.

Nobita's closest friend is Shizuka Minamoto, who also serves as his romantic interest. Nobita is usually tormented by the bully Takeshi Goda, nicknamed "Gian", and the cunning and arrogant Suneo Honekawa. A typical story consists of Doraemon using one of his gadgets in order to assist Nobita in various ways, often causing more trouble than he was trying to solve.
article.heading: Media
Manga
article.paragraph: See alsoList of Doraemon chaptersList of Doraemon Plus chaptersIn December 1969 theDoraemonmanga appeared in six different children's monthly magazines published byShogakukan. The magazines were aimed at children from nursery school to fourth grade. In 1977CoroCoro Comicwas launched as the flagship magazine ofDoraemon.cite book[[The Rough Guide to Manga]]S. YadaJason[[Rough Guides]]978-1-85828-561-0114–115

Since the debut ofDoraemonin 1969, the stories have been selectively collected into forty-five books published from 1974 to 1996. Shogakukan published amaster workscollection consisting of Twenty volumes between July 24, 2009 and September 25, 2012.cite webhttp://www.shogakukan.co.jp/comics/detail/_isbn_9784091434036藤子・Ｆ・不二雄大全集 ドラえもん １January 5, 2015cite webhttp://www.shogakukan.co.jp/comics/detail/_isbn_9784091435019藤子・Ｆ・不二雄大全集 ドラえもん ２０January 5, 2015

In addition, Doraemon has appeared in a variety of manga series by Shgakukan. In 2005 Shgakukan published a series of five more manga volumes under the titleDoraemon+(Doraemon Plus), which were not found in the forty-five Tentmushi pipi volumes. On December 1, 2014, a sixth volume ofDoraemon Pluswas published. This was the first volume for eight years.cite webhttp://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2014-11-15/1st-doraemon-manga-volume-in-8-years-ships-in-december/.810611st Doraemon Manga Volume in 8 Years Ships in December[[Anime News Network]]November 15, 2014December 24, 2014
Ten volumes of the series were available in a bi-lingual edition by Shogakukan English Comics.cite bookManga:The Complete GuideThompsonJasonJason Thompson (writer)978-0-345-48590-8Del Rey Books85–86

In July 2013, Fujiko Fujio Productions announced that they would be collaborating with ebook publisherVoyager BooksVoyager Japanand localization companyAltJapan Co., Ltd.to release an English language version of theDoraemonmanga in full-color digitally via theAmazon Kindleplatform in North America.cite newshttp://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2013-07-28/doraemon-manga-digital-release-coming-to-north-americaClassic Kids' Manga Doraemon Coming to N. America DigitallyAnime News NetworkJuly 28, 2013December 4, 2013Shogakukan released the first volume in November 2013.cite webhttp://www.amazon.com/DORAEMON-Vol-1-FUJIKO-F-FUJIO-ebook/dp/B00GTG4776/DORAEMON Vol.1 [Kindle Edition]Amazon.comDecember 4, 2013This English version incorporates a variety of changes to character names; Nobita is "Noby", Shizuka is "Sue", Suneo is "Sneech", and Gian is "Big G", while dorayaki is "Yummy Bun/Fudgy Pudgy Pie."cite newshttp://ajw.asahi.com/article/behind_news/social_affairs/AJ201311230013English version of 'Doraemon' to enter North American market[[Asahi Shimbun]]November 23, 2013December 4, 2013
article.heading: Anime
Television series
article.paragraph: mainDoraemon (1973 anime)Doraemon (1979 anime)Doraemon (2005 anime)After a brief and unpopular animated series in 1973 byNippon Television,Doraemonremained fairly exclusive in manga form until 1979 when a newly formed animation studio,Shin-Ei Animation(Now owned byTV Asahi) produced an anime series ofDoraemon.cite bookSchillingMarkThe Encyclopedia of Japanese Pop Culture1997WeatherhillNew York3925 December 2014This series became incredibly popular, and ended with 1,787 episodes on March 25, 2005.

Celebrating the anniversary of the franchise, a newDoraemonseries began airing on TV Asahi on April 15, 2005 with newseiyvoice actorsand staff, and updated character designs. On May 12, 2014, TV Asahi Corporation announced an agreement withThe Walt Disney Companyto bring the 2005 series to theDisney XDtelevision channel in the United States beginning in the summer of that year.cite newshttp://asia.nikkei.com/Business/Consumers/Doraemon-plans-to-make-US-debut-this-summerDoraemon plans to make U.S. debut this summerMay 9, 2004May 24, 2014Besides using the name changes that were used in AltJapan's English adaptation of the original manga, other changes and edits have also been made to make the show more relatable to an American audience, such as Japanese text being replaced with English text on certain objects like signs and graded papers, and items such asJapanese yenyen notesbeing replaced byUnited States dollarUS dollar bills. Confirmed cast member of the new American adaptation include veteran anime voice actressMona Marshallin the title role of Doraemon andJohnny Yong BoschofMighty Morphin Power RangersPower RangersandBleach (anime)Bleachfame as Noby. The English dub is produced byBang Zoom! Entertainment.http://licensing14.mapyourshow.com/5_0/exhibitor_details.cfm?exhid=12699&CFID=36365735&CFTOKEN=aec74be628e68047-E8748238-C778-32EC-687CB555182920BFThe series began broadcast in theUnited KingdomonBoomerang (UK & Ireland)Boomerangfrom August 17.cite webhttp://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-08-11/doraemon-to-debut-on-british-cable-and-satellite/.91554Doraemon to Debut on British Cable and SatelliteAugust 11, 2015August 12, 2015[[Anime News Network]]
article.heading: Feature films
article.paragraph: FurtherList of Doraemon filmsIn 1980,Tohoreleased the first of a series of annual feature lengthanimated filmsbased on the lengthy special volumes published annually. Unlike the anime and manga (some based on the stories in select volumes), they are more action-adventure oriented and have more of aShnen mangashnendemographic, taking the familiar characters ofDoraemonand placing them in a variety of exotic and perilous settings. Nobita and his friends have visited the age of thedinosaurs, the far reaches of thegalaxy, the heart of darkest Africa (where they encountered a race of sentient bipedal dogs), the depths of the ocean, and a world ofmagic (paranormal)magic. Some of the films are based onlegendssuch asAtlantis, and on literary works includingJourney to the WestandArabian Nights.Some films also have serious themes, especially on environmental topics and the use of technology. Overall, the films have a somewhat darker tone in their stories, unlike the manga and anime.
article.heading: Video games
article.paragraph: There are a total of 63 Japanese-only video games ranging from platformer games to RPG games, which began with the Emerson'sArcadia 2001system. Doraemon can also be seen inNamco's popularTaiko no Tatsujinrhythm game series likeTaiko no Tatsujin(11Taiko no Tatsujin 1414only),Metcha! Taiko no Tatsujin DS: Nanatsu no Shima no Daibouken,Taiko no Tatsujin Wii,Taiko no Tatsujin Plus, andTaiko no Tatsujin DS: Dororon! Yokai Daikessen!!. The Chinese version of Microsoft's3D Movie Makercontained a Doraemon-themed expansion pack.
article.heading: Musical
article.paragraph: nihongo''Doraemon the Musical: Nobita and the Animal Planet''舞台版ドラえもん のび太とアニマル惑星(プラネット)｣。Butaiban Doraemon: Nobita to Animaru Puranettowas a 2008musical theatremusicalbased on the 1990animefilmDoraemon: Nobita and the Animal Planetof the same name.Event information,News about the musicalIt debuted atTokyo Metropolitan Art Spaceon September 4, 2008 running through September 14.cite webhttp://www.geigeki.jp/english/event_200809_list.html#02Events CalendarTokyo Metropolitan Art SpaceAugust 13, 2008Dead linkSeptember 2010H3llBotWasabi Mizutavoiced Doraemon.
article.heading: Reception
article.paragraph: More than 100 million copies of the manga have been sold.cite webhttp://license-new.shopro.co.jp/products/detail/53ドラえもん（TVアニメ）Shogakukan Production2013-11-28Japanese

Doraemon was awarded the firstShogakukan Manga Awardfor children's manga in 1982. In 1997, it was awarded the firstOsamu Tezuka Culture Award.cite webhttp://www.asahi.com/shimbun/award/tezuka/97a.htmlja:第1回 マンガ大賞 藤子・Ｆ・不二雄 『ドラえもん』（小学館）[[Asahi Shimbun]]JapaneseJuly 18, 2010In 2008, theMinistry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)Japanese Ministry of Foreign Affairsappointed Doraemon as the first anime cultural ambassador.". (March 15, 2008)AFPBB News. Retrieved February 11, 2010.ja iconShingo, Takaoka . "Secret power of Otaku culture Spirits".The WASEDA Guardian. Retrieved February 11, 2010.On 22 April 2002, on the special issue ofAsian HeroinTimemagazine, Doraemon was selected as one of the 22 Asian Heroes. Being the only anime character selected, Doraemon was described as "The Cuddliest Hero in Asia".cite newsIyerPicohttp://www.time.com/time/asia/features/heroes/doraemon.htmlThe Cuddliest Hero in Asia[[Time (magazine)|Time Asia]]February 17, 2010http://www.webcitation.org/5ncD8NhOKFebruary 17, 2010April 29, 2002In 2005, the Taiwan Society of New York selectedDoraemonas a culturally significant work of Japaneseotakupop-culture in its exhibitLittle Boy: The Arts of Japan's Exploding Subculture, curated by renowned artistTakashi Murakami.citation neededJanuary 2015

Jason Thompson (writer)Jason Thompsonpraised the "silly situations" and "old fashioned, simple artwork", with Doraemon's expression and comments adding to the "surrounding elementary-school mischief".

On September 3, 2012, Doraemon was granted official residence in the city of Kawasaki, one hundred years before he was born.cite webDoraemon becomes official resident of Kawasaki a century before his birthhttp://www.japantimes.co.jp/text/nn20120904f1.htmlJapan Times3 September 2012

With the 2013 film,Doraemon: Nobita no Himitsu Dgu Museum, Doraemon has surpassedGodzillain terms of overall ticket sales for a film franchise as Toho's most lucrative movie property. The 33 year series (1980-2013) has sold a combined 100 million tickets vs. the 50 year Godzilla series (1954-2004), which sold a combined 99 million tickets.cite newsSekiguchiTokoGodzilla Loses Top Spot to Kittybot Doraemonhttp://blogs.wsj.com/japanrealtime/2013/03/26/godzilla-loses-top-spot-to-kittybot-doraemon/March 26, 2013The Wall Street JournalMarch 26, 2013It also became the largest franchise by numbers of admissions in Japan.cite webhttp://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/japan-box-office-doraemon-anime-786473Japan Box Office: 'Doraemon' Anime Still All-ConqueringGavin J. BlairApril 6, 2015May 28, 2015[[hollywoodreporter.com]]
article.heading: Legacy
article.paragraph: File:Kawasakicitybus-w-1878.jpgShuttle bus featuring Doraemon to Fujiko.F.Fujio Museum inKawasaki, KanagawaKawasakithumbAFujiko F Fujio museumopened inKawasaki, KanagawaKawasakion September 3, 2011, featuring Doraemon as the star of the museum.cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/anime-star-doraemon-to-have-own-museum-2345688.htmlThe Independent29 August 2011LondonAnime star Doraemon to have own museum

As one of the oldest, continuously running icons, Doraemon is a recognizable character in this contemporary generation. Nobita, the show's protagonist, is a break from other characters typically portrayed as special or extraordinary, and this portrayal has been seen as reasons of its appeal as well as the contrary: especially in the United States.cite newsTETSUO IWAMOTO, Asahi Staff Writerhttp://ajw.asahi.com/article/cool_japan/culture/AJ201209030098Happy birthday! Doraemon will be born 100 years from today[[Asahi Shimbun]]2012-09-032014-01-15

ESP Guitarshave made several Doraemon guitars aimed at children.cite webhttp://espguitars.co.jp/doraemon/index.htmlESP X Doraemonhttps://web.archive.org/web/20130903175610/http://espguitars.co.jp/doraemon/index.htmlSeptember 3, 2013[[ESP Guitars]]cite webhttp://www.espguitars.co.jp/doraemon/index.htmlESP X DoraemonDecember 26, 2014[[ESP Guitars]]

In late 2011, Shogakukan andToyotajoined forces to create a series of live-action commercials as part of Toyota's ReBorn ad campaign. The commercials depict the characters nearly 20 years older. Hollywood actorJean Renoplays Doraemon.cite webhttp://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2012-07-14/jean-reno-goes-to-olympics-as-doraemon-in-new-live-action-adJean Reno Goes to Olympics as Doraemon in New Live-Action Ad – NewsAnime News Network2013-01-272013-01-31

Doraemon has become a prevalent part of popular culture in Japan. Newspapers also regularly make references to Doraemon and his pocket as something with the ability to satisfy all wishes. Other characters in the series are also referenced frequently on TV shows if their cast resembles them.

Doraemon appears in appeals for charity.TV Asahilaunched theDoraemon Fundcharity fund to raise money for natural disasters.cite webDoraemon Fundhttp://www.tv-asahi.co.jp/doraemonbokin/https://web.archive.org/web/20040111135443/http://www.tv-asahi.co.jp/doraemonbokin/January 11, 2004[[TV Asahi]]

Doraemon, Nobita, and the other characters also appear in various educational manga.cite bookManga:Sixty years of Japanese ComicsLaurence King Publishing1-85669-391-0GravettPaulcite webhttp://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2011-06-22/shogakukan-publishes-doraemon-earthquake-survival-guideShogakukan Publishes Doraemon Earthquake Survival Guide[[Anime News Network]]June 22, 2011January 5, 2014Doraemon is also mentioned in several anime and manga by otherMangakamanga artists.Citation neededMarch 2010
